page.title: 07LEAGRAVE
page.content: Leagrave is North-West of Luton's town centre.Before it became a part of Luton it was a small{village}it became a part of Luton in the 1930's.Leagrave is mostly built-up of houses it has {41% terraced houses and 32% semi {-detached,detached,Bungalows and flats {add up to 27%.}In Leagrave, Marsh Road is the{shopping}area.In Marsh Road it has 2 supermarkets,Fine-Fare and Co-op ,small food,shops,newsagents, chemists sport shops,take away shops,snack bars {4 banks}:Barclays,Midland,Lloyds and Natwest,1 Library and a Dry Cleaners and many more.Whitbread Brewery was partially closed,in 1985 due to a strike,but it is still storing but not making beers.Leagrave has a factory called Electrolux making fridges, vacuum cleaners etc,but this is covered in more detail on another page.
